item.title: Bushdeer
item.description: Overview Bushdeer are a genus of deer native to the 2nd and -1st realms. They are herbivores descended from Sika deer, but feature kleptoplastic shrubbery on their antlers and skeleton-like fur patterns.

item.title: Dragons
item.description: Overview Dragons are a genus of amphibians native to the -1st, -3rd, and all ultra-essent realms, including the 2nd. They are omnivorous, flight-capable through the use of alucinara, and semi-aquatic, inhabiting wetlands, rivers, swamps, lakes, and oases.

item.title: Minikin
item.description: Overview Minikin (spp. Anthrosciurus sapiens) are a species of small rodents native to the 2nd realm. They are anthropoid, arboreal omnivores descended from the European Red Squirrel.

item.title: Slugfolk
item.description: Overview Slugfolk are a species of hermaphroditic gastropod mollusks native to the 1st realm. They are terrestrial, semi-anthropoid herbivores descended from the Great Grey Slug.

item.title: Treemice
item.description: Overview Treemice are a species of small arboreal primates native to the 1st and 2nd realms. They are nocturnal omnivores descended from Slow Lorises, consuming tree gum, fruit, leaves, slugs, and mainly insects.

item.title: Wallabies
item.description: Overview Wallabies are a species of marsupials native to the 1st and 2nd realms. They are diurnal herbivores descended from the Dwarf Wallabies of the 0th realm, consuming wild grasses, leaves, and vegetables.

item.title: Wildcats
item.description: Overview Wildcats are a genus of predatory felines native to the -1st and 2nd realms. They are carnivores descended from the European Wildcat.

item.title: Woolly Hogs
item.description: Overview Woolly Hogs are a species of small, woolly suids native to the 2nd realm. They are omnivores descended from the Eurasian Wild Boar.

item.title: Yurikhs
item.description: Overview Yurikhs, also known as Snoutgoats, are a species of small, semi-arboreal goats native to the 1st and 2nd realms, inhabiting the steppes and mountainous areas.
